author: Staff Reporter
text:
A large number of foreign tourists visiting Madurai participated in Pongal celebrations organised by the Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Department at Thenkarai near Sholavandan here on Saturday.

The tourists were given a warm welcome by the villagers in a traditional manner. They were later taken around the village to see the houses beautifully decorated for the festival.

K. Dharmaraj, District Tourism Officer, said that the foreigners were taken to the ancient Moolanathaswamy temple in the village where the history of the temple and the stone inscriptions were explained to them.

Art forms

Folk artistes performed various traditional art forms including karakattam, oyilattam, naiyandi melam and silambattam to entertain the tourists. Students from the Madurai Kamaraj University, studying tourism management, accompanied the foreigners and explained to them the art forms and the festival.

Mr. Dharmaraj said that around 175 tourists, who had come from Britain, Canada, America, the Netherlands, France, Japan and Australia, participated in the event.
title: Foreign tourists participate in Pongal celebrations
